text:
The SVG pasted in below renders the text along the path,
and I see all the characters except the two with empty
content ("!" and "@"). It looks like the rest of the
text is rendered in some default font. Glyph selection
should be

  * If embedded font has a matching glyph, use it
  * Else if embedded font has a <missing-glyph> defined,
    use it.
  * Else don't render this character, go to the next one
    (I think).

Instead, it looks like its doing this:

  * If embedded font has a matching glyph, use it
    (I think this is how the empty glyphs result in
    no "!" or "@" in the output).
  * Else pick the corresponding glyph from some default
    font.

If this were email, I'd attach the rendered PNG file...

Here's the SVG:

-------------------------------


<?xml version="1.0" standalone="no"?>
<!DOCTYPE svg PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD SVG 20010904//EN" 
  "http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-SVG-20010904/DTD/svg10.dtd">
<svg width="12cm" height="3.6cm" viewBox="0 0 1000 300"
     xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">
  <defs>
    <path id="MyPath"
          d="M 100 200 
             C 200 100 300   0 400 100
             C 500 200 600 300 700 200
             C 800 100 900 100 900 100" />

    <font id="Font1" horiz-adv-x="1000">
      <font-face font-family="Super Sans" font-weight="bold" font-style="normal"
          units-per-em="1000" cap-height="600" x-height="400"
          ascent="700" descent="300"
          alphabetic="0" mathematical="350" ideographic="400" hanging="500">
        <font-face-src>
          <font-face-name name="Super Sans Bold"/>
        </font-face-src>
      </font-face>
      <missing-glyph><path d="M0,0h200v200h-200z"/></missing-glyph>
      <glyph unicode="!" horiz-adv-x="300"><!-- Outline of exclam. pt. glyph
--></glyph>
      <glyph unicode="@"><!-- Outline of @ glyph --></glyph>
      <!-- more glyphs -->
    </font>


  </defs>
  <desc>Example toap01 - simple text on a path</desc>

  <use xlink:href="#MyPath" fill="none" stroke="red"  />
  <text font-size="42.5" fill="blue">
    <textPath xlink:href="#MyPath" startOffset='50%' text-anchor='middle'
      style="font-family: 'Super Sans'; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal">
      Yeah, yeah, yeah [!] [@]
    </textPath>
  </text>

  <!-- Show outline of canvas using 'rect' element -->
  <rect x="1" y="1" width="998" height="298"
        fill="none" stroke="blue" stroke-width="2" />
</svg>

text:
Sorry but your understanding of font matching in CSS is wrong.
If the selected font doesn't have a character you are supposed
to go down the font list, which includes a "fallback" font like
'serif' - which is probably where you get your '!' and '@' from.

If when you have checked all the fonts and you can't find one 
with the glyph you use the missing glyph.
